qas.question: What component of water is more soluble than nitrogen?

In what type of water does oxygen dissolve more slowly?
How much more oxygen dissolves at 0 degrees C than at 20 degrees C?
What is nitrogen more water soluble than?
What does air in equilibrium with water contain?
What is the solubility water in oxygen dependent on?

<a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4><b5_0>Oxygen<b5_0/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> is more soluble in water than nitrogen is. Water in equilibrium with air contains approximately 1 molecule of dissolved O
2 for every 2 molecules of N
